intro: Dentaria gemmata, commonly known as the gemmed toothplant, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Dentaria gemmata typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
